39744147.review:
A very fun and fairly balenced KoF fighting game; a port from PS2. This game has some nice music (some songs I don't like personally), a difficult trial mode (I can't do an Overkill), and some fast pased fighting game action. This is for people that want to show off to their friends that they can do combos and look real cool while doing it. 

Some cons: 
- Fightcade exists, with their totally free KoF 2002. It's not Unlimited Match, but it's free. 
- Online sucks. No one is one line and if they are, the game is wholly laggy.
- Game can be weirdly sluggish. The way to fix this lag is to put your computer to the lowest resolution, run the game, then change your monitor's resolution back. From there, you can run the game again and change to what ever resolution you want.
- Minor nitpick, Omega Rugal and Normal Zero don't have the same voice he had in previous games and in comparsion, they really suck. lol

Some pros:
+ Very large roster. 65 characters to experiment and have great fun with.
+ Balenced game play. KoF 2002 can be.... a little busted. Unlimited Match tries to help with that. [i] A little bit. [/i]


Overall. I'll give this game a Geneside Cuttah / 10. I'll only recommend if you are bored and you want a game that doesn't hold your hand at all. If you are pretty new to fighting games, might I recommend Street Fighter V or Dragon Ball FighterZ? :p

No solo es la mejor entrega de la saga King of Fighters, sino que también se trata de la mejor versión de KOF 2002, con los personajes extras que no se encontraban originalmente presentes en la edición estándar de los arcades, además de un gameplay un tanto mejor refinado, y algunos movimientos especiales nuevos. Simplemente uno de los más grandes juegos de lucha de la historia, que le pasa el trapo incluso a la última iteración de la saga.

36093229.review:
Las mecánicas y jugabilidad son similires a la anterior 2002, pero con diferencias muy marcadas, como, por ejemplo, el nivel de los personajes esta mejor balanceado, (personajes como choi, Billy, kim y angel, no están muy por encima de los demás). Con respecto a algunos de estos personajes y también al juego en general, los combates son mas rapidos, no tiene los mismos bugs que la 2002 anterior, una vez derribado tu oponente, lo puedes golpear estando en el suelo en un momento preciso con algunos personajes, (casos como kio 1, Andy, daimon, bad, hinako, nameless, entre otros), en ocasiones, con algunos golpes el personaje puede rebotar en el límite de la pantalla y ser golpeado posteriormente con otro movimiento, puedes ejecutar los SDM (super desesperation move) y los HSDM (hidden super desesperation move o como se les conoce popularmente el quinto o el oculto) sin tener la necesidad de “explotar” (SP+LK) y algunos DM (desesperation move) y movimientos en general diferentes en esta entrega. 

Con respecto al juego, tienen una muy buena variedad de personajes, se puede disfrutar mucho de el en su modo “offline”, ya que cuenta con desafíos, el modo árcade está muy bien y puedes jugar en modo versus de manera local, la dificultad está bien, su apartado grafico está bien (En este aspecto no le exijo mucho a esta entrega, ya que es un juego de lucha en 2d dirigido sobre todo a las máquinas de árcade y no es su principal apartado a destacar, pienso que a partir de kof2006 maximum impact 2 se empiezan a trabajar mejor los personajes en su apartado gráfico y artístico), los escenarios están bien (es un solo plano) y el soundtrack de cada team respectivamente es variado y está muy bien.

Con respecto al online: Cuando busques partida y encuentres a alguien con un Nick como 亚历克斯, lo más probable es que sea alguien de Taiwán o china (donde aún es muy popular esta 2002UM) buscando retas, pero en su región, debido a la distancia saldrá un pin de más de 500 y por ese motivo la mayoría de veces te expulsa. Mi consejo si quieres encontrar a alguien con quien tener duelos de manera fluida (sin ser del todo perfecta), es que busques grupos relacionados con kof de esta región, podras encontrar a alguien que aún lo juegue ocasionalmente y tendrás un pin relativamente bajo y configurar la opción “input delay” de manera correcta y sincronizada con la de tu oponente (recomiendo 30 o 25, es mi caso). Se puede llegar a tener buenos duelos (Repito, no del todo perfectos).

Los puntos negativos en mi opinión, son el online, que no está del todo roto, pero debes tener una configuración correcta para que funcione apenas fluido y no lo suficientemente bien, difícilmente puedes encontrar a alguien que aún lo juegue, ya que esta versión (UM) no fue tan popular en esta región. Otro punto en su contra es su precio. Para un juego que oficialmente fue lanzado en 2009 en ps2 y unos años después en steam, debería ser más barato en su precio normal y la mala remasterizacion en las voces de algunos personajes. 

Con respecto a su precio normal se queda corto en las horas de juego que puede llegar a ofrecer, si solo tuviera en cuenta este aspecto, recomendaría comprar en rebajas o cuando este en oferta de manera individual, la calidad del juego en general está bien, esta entrega (2002UM) de the King of fighters, en mi opinión es de Las mejores dentro de esta franquicia en el género de lucha.

Si lo tuviera que puntuar de 1 a 10 con respecto a todo lo anterior, le daría un 7. Mi humilde opinión.

34900428.review:
I'll start this by saying that you will find a better review of the game than this one. As for the old review, I was playing the game on a PC with a 3.10 Ghz processor, but 1 GB or RAM, so the game crashing was not a surprise.

The plot of the King of Fighters series is split into sagas shown in a trilogy of games (I consider [i]The King of Fighters '94[/i] to be an exception personally, that game was just an idea that gave birth to the series). After the final entry of the saga, SNK releases a game with no plot that features characters from the previous saga: a Dream Match. This origin of this comes from the subtitle of [i]The King of Fighters '98[/i] in Japan: [i]Dream Match Never Ends[/i]. That was the series inaugural Dream Match game, which had most of the characters from the Orochi Saga, the previous trilogy from '95 to '97.

SNK would release another trilogy of games after '98 known as the NESTS Saga. Unfortunately, the company was facing financial difficulties and had to close down after the release of [i]The King of Fighters 2000[/i], the middle entry of the Saga. Eolith, a Korean-based company formed by former SNK employees, released the next entry in the series 2001 along with its Dream Match, 2002. When SNK returned as SNK Playmore they eventually released an enhanced version of KOF '98: [i]The King of Fighters '98: Ultimate Match[/i]. Since they never properly got to make a dream match game for KOF 2002, they eventually got down to it. This game became [i]The King of Fighters 2002: Unlimited Match[/i], which was previously released on the PlayStation 2 and Xbox 360.

The game takes the original roster from KOF 2002 and makes changes and expansions to it. Every character that previously appeared in the NESTS Saga, including bosses, is now available in the game, so teams had to be re-arranged.The game now 18 teams with a total of 66 characters, beating the 62 total from [i]Mortal Kombat: Armageddon[/i] (but not the 200 total from [i]Tobal 2[/i]). The only character that is not in the game is K9999, who is replaced by a new character: Nameless, who has similar moves to him along with his own backstory and motivations.

The fighting engine was also given an overhaul and characters were rebalanced, as they now have new moves, Desperation Moves and other changes. Character artwork is now done by Hiroaki and the stages have been changed as well. The soundtrack was also completely changed from the original, the music is probably one of the best KOF has had. In conclusion, the game looks nothing like the original version, but completely improves it.

The game uses the same system as the original game, fights are done with a team of three characters, though players can also play with a single character using a system of rounds. The game's fighting system is similar to the "Advanced Mode" in KOF '98, using a super meter with three stocks (more as characters are eliminated). This meter allows characters to perform a variety of defensive and offensive moves, notably the Desperation and Super Desperation Moves.  The game also inludes Hidden Super Desperation Moves (also known as Super MAX2) and the meter can be used to perform super cancels. Another feature is the Max Mode which allows players to freely cancel attacks along with other offensive features.

The game includes a survival mode: "Endless Mode" as well as a Challenge Mode with two different sets of challenges. These modes are there for the player to have fun and test themselves as the game has no unlockables, all characters are available from the start. The game also includes online play.

Just like with The King of Fighters '98: Ultimate Match and [i]The King of Fighters XIII[/i], this game is meant to be a "Jumping-On Point" for newcomers who have never played previous games. The roster might look overwhelming to some players but it is impossible to complain since there should be a character for anyone (what with all those Kyo clones). KOF fans obviously know that this is an awesome game, there's no reason to recommend it to them. If you've never played KOF before and like fighting games then what are you waiting for?

And if you've played fighting games and love the genre and choose not to play this, that's a horrible shame. Do something about that.

KOF 2002 Unlimited Match is one of the biggest KOF juggernauts with the largest character selection in the franchise.  When it comes to multiplayer potential it is the absolute best and has every single character from the NESTS saga and then some with one exception.

33355586.review:
It works solid, netcode isn't annoying when playing with people in your region.  Playing with people in far off distant lands lands delays relative between ISP and distance but whats important is the netcode isn't unstable, doesn't time out for no reason, doesn't teleport lag (telelag) doesn't stutter, doesn't take forever to connect, doesn't read inacurately, doesn't crash the game.  Unfortunately, SNK took too long to get this to steam PC for it to pick up a playerbase local to north america to have any constant flow of players to fight with.  It's a desert out there.  Your games will consist of having friends to play with from time to time of which when you do, and if they're not on the polar end of the globe with average internet service, it will play like a dream come true.  That's what's important.  It doesn't require any servers other them steam and steamworks as 3rd party to function so it will never die out.  You can pick it up and dust it off anytime steam functions and play online.

On top of that they improved 2002 ver of KOF in various aspects and tweaks gameplay wise so it's even better then before.

98' and '02 are my fav of the KOF series from SNK's 2D fighter franchise.

I'd recommend this when it's on sale and not the full price.  Why?  Emulated community-maintained online versions of this game and earlier SNK and CP2 titles have way way more interesting online features and more online player support per match then what's offered in this one.

Like what? I donno about FIGHTCADE but Mame32K, Mame64K and Mame32++ offer way more control customization, ROM customization, tweakable settings and most importantly, offer MORE THEN 6 PLAYERS ONLINE in match.  They even offer multiplayer support for single-player campaigns allowing you to online emulate with up to 3 of your friends a co-op campaign against AI.  Or 3 vs 3 online (like KOF 14 now has!) + spectators too not to mention online training mode.  The K in Mame32K stands for kaillera and doesn't offer the best multiplayer sync code in the world.  It desyncs can hang and freeze emulator and sound like a broken record till u ctrl+alt+del it, but when it works it's the best thing ever.

Ever.

Forever.

It will never get old as a result.  Donno if FIGHTCADE and GGPO and RomStation.fr have such unique co-op and 6 player online features, but they def have more stable netcode then kaillera.

King of Fighters XIV has learned from the community and incorporated 3vs3 online, online training mode, as well as the most stable netcode i've ever seen in my life.

I'd recommend KOF14 over this KOF02 UM due to online features.  Yes it's quite a different game over '02 in terms of newer mechanics and characters missing a lot of their classic move-sets from '98, '99, '00, '01, '02 ,'03 etc (a trend that KOF13 started) prob due to balance reasons, but once u get used to it, it's the shit.  It's really fucking good.

Get KOF '02 UM when it's on sale simply because anyone that plays KOF14 or KOF in general will always eventually want to nostalgia online with friends some KOF '02 or KOF'98 and so on, on steam for stable play.  It almost always happens and you would want to be privy to that situation when it lines up with your friends and have the game accessible to play in your library.

Heck, if you leave the lobby public and open long enough you will get more players joining, happy as a clam they searched at the right time online, play against you, add you to friends list and then you'll have more excuses to go play KOF '02 UM.

For any KOF fan, it's a good way to pay tribute to SNK for the great fighting games they made and give them any excuse whatsoever to continue to keep considering awesome ports to PC as much as possible.  Get it on sale so it's worth ur money, get it in general cuz it's worth ur time.  It's a solid port, end of story.

32213123.review:
The King of Fighters 2002 Unlimited Match
El juego es bastante fiel al original (Arcade), y es un buen port. 
Hablando del juego en sí, KoF 2002 UM añade muchas mejoras que traen un mejor balance al original, errores y bugs que podían ser explotados para trabar al oponente. Se hicieron mejoras gráficas en los sprites de los personajes que mantiene la sensación de estar jugando al original. Se hicieron modificaciones a los movimientos de los personajes, lo que hace que se reinveten los combos que se podían hacer en el original.
Pros:
[list]
[*]Sistema fluído igual al original.
[*]Gran variedad de personjes: Un rost de 66 personajes en total.
[*]Mejor balance en las peleas.
[*]Varios modos de juego.
[*]Buen nivel de reto (como todo juego de SNK).
[/list]
Contras:
[list]
[*]No tiene sistema de galería.
[*]Los escenarios están bien, pero no tienen esa sinergia del original.
[*]La omisión de Orochi Iori (estando presente en la versión 2002 original para PS2)
[*]Omisión de 'partida rápida' local en Vs. CPU.
[*]Online vacío. (Aunque esto ya es externo al juego).
[/list]
No será perfecto, pero el juego está bastante completo, una versión que logra mejorar a su modo al original, una buena adición a tu biblioteca de juegos si te gustan los juegos de peleas y si también creciste con o ha sido has jugado en algún momento de tu vida los juegos de arcade y KoF.
[b]8/10 - Bueno[/b]

32047741.review: Awesome classic fighter with style and replayability to spare. This is much like King of Fighters 98, in that it's a "dream match" game without any story - it throws together just about every KOF character to date (to date in 2002, at least), even fighters who are dead in the storyline, so that you can create a true dream team of any combination. A few of the 2000s era KOF fighters are a bit lame, but there are also some great additions to the cast like Vanessa, Seth, and Kula Diamond. All in all, whichever fighters you like the best, there is a huge roster to pick from. It’s not just about sheer quantity, though – KOF 2002 has a great fighting system that is quite easy to pick up and play. This Steam edition of the game even has some updated features that make it the definitive version of KOF 2002: a polished presentation, some new music, a few old fighters get fresh moves, some balancing changes, a new fighter is added in, and there are extra game modes to fool around with. I’m pretty impressed with the work that was done to buff this game up for the modern market. I haven't had a chance to try the online functions, so I can't comment on that aspect of things, but everything else is gold. If you don't have the cash for KOF XIV, go ahead and grab this one.

28884667.review:
A terceira e última atualização de KoF 2002, também conhecida como Tougeki, por ter sido feito um rebalanceamento para ser jogado no torneio Super Battle Opera, no Japão, em 2010, chega para PCs, após ser lançada para outras plataformas, como Xbox Live Arcade, NESiCAxLive, QQ Game, PS2 e System Board Y2, onde teve seu lançamento original, nos arcades japoneses, ainda em 2009, em sua primeira versão "UM".

No que tange a jogabilidade, há diferenças sutis entre ambas as versões UM, mas o mesmo não se dá nas diferenças gráficas, onde em sua primeira versão UM há todo um refinamento que não pôde ser notado nesta última versão, dando a entender que estas possivelmente foram retiradas para deixar os cenários o mais estático possível, devido ao modo online.

Um ponto negativo que merece registro é o fato desta versão para PC não possuir recursos de galeria de imagens, customização de cores dos personagens, e outros que podem ser vistos nas versões para consoles.

O modo online apresenta talvez o melhor netcode já feito para jogos de luta, onde muitas desenvolvedoras deveriam olhar os jogos deste gênero com maior atenção ao criarem seus modos online, uma vez que este gênero, como FPS e outros, precisam do maior detalhamento e menor perda possível de pacotes, durante a transmissão de dados, e este foi um trabalho excelente por parte da Code Mystics; porém, é preciso notar que recursos presentes em outros jogos de luta que possuem modo online não fazem parte deste jogo, como multi salas, aguardar o oponente enquanto se treina ou joga no modo arcade, replay, gravação ou divulgação de partidas, entre outros, marcando assim, um ponto negativo, mesmo com a alta qualidade do modo online.

Para você que está começando agora nos jogos de luta e deseja apenas jogar casualmente ou mesmo tornar-se um jogador a nível competitivo, é certo que este jogo atenderá suas necessidades, uma vez que possui um dos - senão o - maiores elencos já feito oficialmente para um jogo de luta, te dando a chance de escolher um time de acordo com a sua peculiaridade, e pelo fato do jogo ter uma matiz enorme de personagens carismáticos dentro da franquia, certamente você encontrará boas razões para adquirí-lo.

Para você que já joga algum KoF mas nunca jogou nenhuma versão da 2k2, recomendo que tenha esta versão, usando as anteriores apenas como um valor referencial, porque, como dito acima, ele agrada em todos os níveis, desde o iniciante até o competidor de alto nível.

Para os chamados kofeiros, que, infelizmente pararam no tempo, alegando que a versão 2k2 original é a melhor de todas e que nenhum outro KoF o superará, digo que dêem uma chance a esta versão; que testem exaustivamente, já que possuem longa experiência com KoF 2k2, vejam os prós e contras, e mesmo que tenham que substituírem seus personagens, que joguem sem preconceitos para formarem uma opinião realmente sólida, pois essa é a característica de quem está aberto a mudanças e poderá testá-lo para saber se é um jogo que vale a pena ser comprado, apoiando a empresa que vocês tanto criticam, quando eles dão passos diferentes dos que vocês foram criados, lá em 2002, nos fliperamas, e criam novos KoFs, porém da forma que vocês não esperariam, e insistem em censurarem KoFs pós-2k2, mantendo-se trancados em suas casas, jogando versões ilegais, via emuladores e ainda se dizendo uma cena(!).

Do iniciante ao experiente, que começou a jogar KoF em 1994, acompanhando todas as versões, mas que, talvez ainda não tenha jogado esta versão de KoF 2k2, vale a pena ser adquirido, tanto pela jogabilidade, gráficos, trilha sonora e nível de dificuldade alta para os que gostam de se desafiarem.

Como apenas mais um jogador no meio de tantos, não me sinto arrependido de ter feito esta aquisição e venho praticando e gostando a cada vez que redescubro as possibilidades deste jogo, e, sobretudo, desta franquia que acompanho desde o início.

28718194.review:
[h1]"Bring back the exictement of the past KOF memories......"[/h1]
After 2001, it's the end of the King of The Fighters ~ NESTS saga. You would be wondering, Is there a new story coming out from Eolith? Well, no, you will be playing the Dream Match game once more, after KOF98. The second dream match is up for you players to have another experience on the fighting arena once more. Behold! King of the Fighters 2002 ~ Challenge to the Ultimate Battle! 

This game doesn't rules, but bringing back the past KOF memories.....With New Face Team back, Iori's past team mates Vice and Mature ''revived''. Rugal...... well, I can gurentee you would want to play it. And all characters were stronger now. With moves, and new experience! 

This game doesn't have storyline, unfortunately, but it doesn't matter, since you are playing the ''non-story'' KOF game. This game still provides some pack of fun and fighting experience that you've ever imagined. However, your boss, is still the same Omega Rugal, except for now, he's much stronger. 

Artwork could use some improvement. But a big great news is Athena became a main ''model'' for this years KOF. Her hair is longer, her cloths is beautiful. and her two fans will be with her during the whole out battle. With a cute introduction pose. She even prettier than KOF99 (sure, she is 10x better than she was in KOF2001). However, the character portraits could give some improvement. Not bad in terms of drawing, but the style doesn't give out the sense of beauty. But more or less it's up to players who decide this. I still prefer the KOF2000 artwork if you ask me. 

Gameplay is still the same way as the previous KOF games, you still fight, with power bar which you fight to build it up. And use the Desperation Moves or Super Desperation Moves to do a finishing move to a character, it's the same old way that KOF games that they ever provided. Except that now, Characters gained a Hidden Super Desperation Moves, which you have to activate it when you're low on life. And needed certain command to execute it. Not bad actually. 

Some of the old abilities like: Cancel, Autoguard, Backstep Jump, Rolling is back in this game. Surely, mastering the usage of those abilities will help tremendously on your fighting skills throughout the whole game. But those need some time to master it. For experienced KOF players, this never be a trouble for them. But for newbies, mastering them needs some time. Honed with those skills help you playing the versus mode easier, when you want to challenge someone into battle. Connecting Combo moves and end with a finishing move is a KOF players goal. That's what you've to do on it. Since you are more focused on combo's, not the basic Street Fighter II fighting style anymore. 

Music is somewhat downgraded. Although it is taken from the previous KOF songs, I still prefer the old theme. It feels like Eolith just take the theme from the previous games and simply rearranged it. But Arcade centers are usually noisy, you won't hear that so clearly. Try to buy the soundtrack if you want to. Voice acting is good. Character voice acting is changed, to much aggressive tone. But sometimes, you'll get annoyed. Have a rest if those bugged you too much. 

Loving this game is easy, replay this game is fun, but to master this game still needs your previous KOF experience and skills to play it. It's not easy if you ask me, the CPU's difficulty is tweaked, and your opponent is much smarter, and more difficult. 

Overall this game is provided the best gameplay so far, so it says ''Graphic doesn't matter much, gameplay must be fun and attractive.''. I rather Eolith refines the graphic and their artwork. If they do so, I would be definitely mad on this game.......Well, at least I do love Athena this year for now! ^_^ 

Pros:-- 

-Good gameplay 
-Athena is prettier 
-New Abilities and Super powers, worth to try it out 
-New gameplay experience 

Cons:-- 

-Artwork needs improvement 
-Music 
-Difficulty is much higher than before 

Overall it has more pros. than cons. But overall it is a nice game. I can't complain much on this. Hop on, It's time to play KOF2002 again. In arcade!~

27665647.review:
Comprei o jogo com muito medo quanto a portabilidade.
Depois de muito analisar, eis o resultado:

. O jogo é um port fiel a versão arcade (não da versão Playstation 2)
. É possível deixar o jogo em full screen + wide screen (igual era nos fliperamas e Playstation 2)
. Há opção para remover essas barras/ molduras laterais e deixar o jogo com o aspecto original
. Utilizando o SweetFX você pode facilmente inserir e calibrar scanline dentre outros filtros (para quem quiser deixar o jogo com o mesmo visual do Fliperama na época de seu lançamento)
. O port desse jogo junto ao TKOF 98 UM de Playstation 2 são os dois melhores TKOF que já joguei nesses mais de 20 anos da franquia
. Compatibilidade mais que perfeita com joysticks além da vasta opção de configuração dos botões (incluindo atalhos)
. Diferente da versão para Playstation 2 esse jogo não inclui o original TKOF 2002 de NeoGeo
. Diferente da versão Playstation 2 aqui todos os personagens já começam habilitados
. Não testei o Versus Online (não posso opinar)
. Esse jogo é uma das raras edições para console que não teve as músicas remixadas, no entanto a qualidade original está muito boa
. O jogo de fato não tem DRM, o que deixa ele ainda melhor

Curiosidade:
.Estranho esse jogo ter o título "2002", ele sequer parece um reamake dessa edição. Ele tá mais pra um Aniversary Edition. Sem enredo, com trocentos personagens, mas absurdamente divertido e bem feito. Similar a edição comemorativa que foi o TKOF 98.
. Fazendo uma longa pesquisa me parece que esse jogo foi portado da versão "Tougeki", aquela com os bugs corrigidos para deixar o jogo mais equilibrado no Versus.

Conclusão:
Excelente Port
Nota 9/10

24228837.review: This game is a love letter to KoF fans and 2D fighting game fans alike. It is utterly charming in both its presentation, art style and of course, the mass selection of playable characters on offer. Like KoF98, 2002 is a game without a story and features characters from all over the KoF canon, both deceased and active, both good and evil. Kudos to SNK for the astounding amount of content on offer here. With a challenging but fair Arcade mode, Team play, local VS, online play, some practically impossible but motivating Steam achievements, what you have here is a masterpiece in not only 2D fighting gaming, but in fighting games as a whole. To anyone who loves brutally challenging games, masterful hand-drawn artwork and one of the biggest rosters in a fighting game, then do yourself a favour and get King of Fighter 2002 Unlimited Match.

23243278.review:
Just like KOF'98 Ultimate Match,this is another entry in SNK's favourite ''Dream Match''series.This particular KOF includes almost ALL characters from the NESTS saga(including bosses).While not feeling particularly different from 98,it sets itself apart with a GREATLY made art style,updated character sprites and new moves for each of our favourite characters.
One noticable change,was in the Desperation Moves.In order to use a Super Desperation Move,you no longer can activate,via meter activation(when your character glows),but rather pressing two buttons instead of one in order to pull off a Super Version of a Desperation Move.
Also this game has,what has now become a staple of the series - HSDM's(Hidden Super Desperation Moves).These particular moves can be activated,only when your character's health reaches a certain low(when the life bar begins glowing red).Inputting a certain command,while your health bar is low(and your super metter is Level 3),you can unleash a devastating(and visually impressive)super attack,acting as your last chance to get back into the fight.
I may be nitpicking here,but there were certain changes here that i didn't like - the aformentioned commands to use an SDM and some characters moveset have changed commands,lie for example: Terry Bogard's Rising Tackle abandoned the old command from KOF 98,and now you must briefly crouch and then press upwards and Strong Punch; Or,Benimaru's Triple Resist kick,going from a simple half-circle light kick,to Whip kick then up-down Strong Kick.I'm maybe nitpicking,but these small changes seemed pretty jarring to me.
Overall,a very good follow up to KOF'98 with awesome artwork,great character sprites,deeper fighting and newer characters.
9 K' sunglasses out of 10 :)

22851768.review:
THE BEST KOF EVER! (In my humble opinion, of course)

I dont know, but I fell like my review is going to be biased by the fact that I played a lot of this game back in the days it was released, so its a game very dear to me, and seeing it back here on Steam in this improved version is so amazing!

The Roster

First, you should know that this is not the regular version of KOF 2002, but the Unlimited Match version, which includes tons of extra features. One of them is the expanded roster, which includes not only the original KOF2002 chars, but also each and every char from KOF 99 to KOF 2002. So, chars like Kasumi, Heidern, Shingo and many others were add to the cast, making the character selection screeen became HUGE!

The Gameplay

The gameplay of a Kof game is basically a faster and furious version of Street Fighter. Its very combo heavy and demands a lot of practice from the player. So be prepared to spend a lot of time in the training mode practicing your set ups and combos, because the players you will find online do it a lot. Also, as I said before, this version contains aditional features, which are some new moves and specials for many chars, so it will surprise the kof veterans a bit, in a good way.

The Online Play

The whole point of a fighting game in the era of the internet is to play online, as most local arcades have closed down. So Kof 2002 UM includes an online play feature, with both Player Matches (casual) and Ranked Matches. But here is the thing: there are only a few players online and you will only find random online fighters on the weekends. Most of the online play in this game is made via your own friend list. That is: you add people from your country our nearby countries and, when they are online, you ask them to play with you. Thats how the online play has been working for the kof games here on Steam. ITS NOT DEAD, it just works the way I described.

Final Veredict

Overall its a pretty solid fighting game made for those who are really into the genre and like a fast paced fighter. Its also a classic game from the arcade era and playing it might be very nostalgic to some (like me). This Unlimited Match version actually improves the game a lot by adding new features like more chars, moves and the online mode, thus making the game even better.

I rate it 9.0 / 10.0

22496653.review:
King of Fighters 2002 Unlimited Match is a fighting game created by SNK Playmore (creators of Metal Slug series). This version added more rosters from predecessors (correct me if I am wrong) and game tweaks. The fighting mechanics work well, but they're missing the juggle from the console version which is my favourite thing in fighting games genre. They added the multiplayer as well but the community is dead anyway. Controllers are welcome as well.

[h1]+ Pros[/h1]
 + Added fighters from predecessors
 + Around 50 rosters
 + Endless Mode
 + Controller support
 + 2 player support split screen (one with keyboard and controller or 2 controllers for fair match)
 + Satisfying MAX2 moves

[h1]- Cons[/h1]
 - Juggling is missing
 - Tough boss fight (Even when you put CPU level 3 on Options)
 - Multiplayer is dead
 - Skill List seems to be weird (There are some Russian language for other fighters and some complex MAX2 moves for some fighters)

Around 50 rosters, MAX2 moves for comeback and Endless mode seems to be a great addition, but they miss out the juggle mechanic on PC version which is what I was really disappointed. But that doesn't mean the game is unenjoyable. Overall, it is really hard to recommend for newcomers and KOF veterans on this version. This is probably the only fighting game I would spend on while waiting for Tekken 7 coming on PC or console if it's not going to happen. I would recommend Street Fighter, Skullgirls, Blazblue, Guilty Gear and King of Fighters XIII if you want a decent fighting game on PC.

[h1] Un KOF que debemos jugar [/h1]

Buscaba un juego de peleas que pudiera ser entretenido y que la mayoría pudiera jugar; casi siempre la respuesta es: Street Fighter o King of Fighters. En este caso decidí ir por el segundo y admito que iba con dudas, pero debo admitir que no me arrepentí. Si estas [b] decidiendo entre KOF 98 UM o este juego [/b] y lo que buscas en realidad es que puedas tener retas de manera local y que todos puedan participar, probablemente este sea tu juego.

Y es que a pesar de tener mecánicas más avanzadas que otros KOF (cómo el 98 UM) este se siente un póco más familiar. El novato con poca práctica podrá defenderse mejor y los más avanzados podrán intentar nuevas formas de ataque gracias a los nuevos poderes y valores agregados en el juego. Definitivamente [b] vale la pena [/b] aunque quizá por donde flaquea más es por el lado de las retas online que son sumamente escasas; eso sí, en la comunidad del juego, podrás encontrar a otros jugadores quienes también buscan luchar, por lo que sería bueno que una vez que te decidas por el juego y quieras tener retas en linea, te des una vuelta por ahí.

Hablando de retos, el juego tiene muchos y variados desafíos los cuales van desde realizar counters hasta sobrevivir al ataque SDM de C.Zero sin que tú tengas nada de vida ¿Complicado? Quizá (es muy sencillo en realidad) pero divertido. Entonces, ¿KOF 2002 UM vale la pena? ¡Claro que si! No es tan "táctico" como el 98 UM pero, por la gran cantidad de personajes a seleccionar, los nuevos escenarios con un buen apartado gráfico (¿Conoces a todos los personajes de los fondos?) y los nuevos poderes especiales, harán que disfrutes mucho la partida. 

Eso si, no está K9999, pero esta nameless quién seguramente será de tu agrado (aunque extrañes mucho al original)

TL;DR A good fighter with tight controls and good mechanics. 9.9/10 that claw guy freaks me out

Tight controls, unique and memorable characters despite a huge roster, great graphics, great stages, and an easy to navigate menu system. You can be in a fight in 10 seconds flat, or in an online match with a friend in under 30 seconds. There's both simple and complex combos that are easy to learn, and even the most complex ones can be mastered with some practice. The only clone character specifically say it's a clone (technically it's an older style of the same character, but it's so close it might as well be a clone), other than that all characters have unique combos and styles.

21286941.review:
Otro de los clásicos de SNKP, el segundo KOF dreammatch.

Este juego, a diferencia de KOF98UM, él cual toma la música original de la versión de NeoGeo, desecha casi por completo el juego hecho por los coreanos de Eolith y rehace el juego desde cero, cambiando al 100% los escenarios y música de fondo, lo único que permanece es su jugabilidad, y a medias, ya que también corrige el gran desequilibrio de personajes que había en la versión original de NeoGeo.

Gran cantidad de personajes, es muy dificil aburrirse por variedad en este juego.

El juego no consume recursos, la PC más austera podrá ejecutar este juego.

El único aspecto negativo es su modo online, el cual está basado en input delay, si bien no va mal no es perfecto comparado con un netcode basado en rollback, el cual ya comienza a dar problemas de lentitud a más de 250ms de ping.

Una compra obligada si eres un fan de los juegos de pelea de la vieja escuela a un precio bastante accesible.

21267440.review:
The best Dream Match KOF tournament ever. I came from KOFXIII andS SVC Chaos back to this after having not touched it for over a decade. It's always great when an arcade game when a good port, and the online works great for matching up with friends.

This is a lot faster than '98 and it doesn't have XI's tag system, but the combo game is intense and there is a lot of variability with even basic bread-and-butter inputs.  Ifeel this game is pretty acessible, plusall the characters are balanced really well (save the bonus characters from the arcade, the boss characters and various console exclusives, or the shadow/chaos variant of some character, like Shadow Chris), so you can feel fairly confident hitting Edit Random and learning different characters rather than just your main. There is also a huge amount of depth to the game though; there are challenge modes that are great for building general fighting game skills, and the amount of different ways you can do combos with different moves is insane.
9.8/10, Favourite SNK Playmore game and one of the GOAT fighting games.

20765510.review:
This is one of the best fighting games I have played in a while.  While this game is a big upgrade to a previous game, I could not help but compare the difference between it's predecessor KOF02 for the neo geo and this game KOF02UM.

The Pros:
- Excellent soundtrack for each team and boss characters
- the teams seem to have their own stages.
- The bosses from KOF99 to KOF01 are present and playable
- The characters not found in KOF02 such as Lin, May Lee and Jhun are here in KOF02UM
- Many different modes to choose from such as practice, challenge and online
- certain artwork opens when you win against Rugal as a team
- Most MAX2 moves are changed.  They are easier to remember and perform now.
- Some characters' moves or properties have been changed or added.  EX - Heidern's Neck Rolling is now unblockable.  EX- Xiang Fei's super is a string of commands.   

The Cons:
- Bosses can be overwhelmingly difficult.
- The win quotes for each character are the same no matter who you win against.  EX - Ralf has a certain quote when he wins against a female on the last round in KOF02.  It does not show any personality for the characters.
- There is no gallery for the artwork [as far as I see].  As far as artwork is concerned, I like it in color but that is personal preference.
- You only get one chance against Rugal
- no story/background for each team.  Need to find external source to read about it.  If they added it as unlockable material in this game, then it would be amazing in my opinion.
- In KOF98 and previous games, your teammates would be in the background cheering their team.  In this game, it is not here.  Another personal preference by me.

Overall, I like this game.  I would recommend buying it when it is at a discount.

20166759.review:
Short version : 
this game is excellent, great roster, great balance, tweaks from original kof2002 are for the better. Decent netcode if you stay continental. Just don't be rebuted by character graphics and you'll find a deep game.


Long version :
this game is an updated kof2002. Some characters return from previous years, some had changes. Also, it incorporates the latests tweaks from arcade version.

The base system is from 2002 (max mode, super cancels, max supers, max2 supers), however some important tweaks allow better overall balance and usefulness.
Max and Max2 supers are doable directly, outside of max mode, for 1 additional bar (so 3 bars in total). This makes some Max and Max2 much more useful and relevent, like Maxima Max Maxima Revenger and Max Arch enemy, Takuma Max2 reversal or Angel Max reversal because you don't have to enter max mode.
Super during max mode doesn't cost another bar, it simply ends max mode. Also a super cancel during max mode also doesn't cost bar, so a combo in max mode like normal>special>supercancel-super would only cost 1 bar for entering max mode. 
Quick Max still costs 2 levels total (1 for cancel, 1 for max mode).

All the above plus the numerous tweaks on characters movesets make the game extremelly well balanced.
There are 66 characters in total. Not including bosses which have more health and unfair movesets, and counting alternate versions, this leaves a total of 61 characters, which is nothing short of staggering.

Background graphics are nice, if a little flat because they use 2D.
Character graphics are probably the game's weak point. They're blocky and worst of all the filtering options don't do a lot.
Because the game is 2D, it's requirements are very low, and even low end laptops can play it fine.
Sound is great with good voice and effect quality and numerous themes remixes.
Controls are top notch, use of a gamepad or an arcade stick is heavily recommended. Works with direct input devices (AKA many gamepads and PS3 wired sticks and pads).

Netcode is good if you manage to stay under 350ms of ping. Find players within your continent and you'll be fine.
The game has also local versus play of course.

For me, it's the best fighting game to this day. It's only held back by outdated character graphics, but don't let that detract you from the immense depth this game has.

킹오파 최신작인 XIII은 무리한 고해상도 도트 노가다  덕분에 스프라이트가 많이 삭제되어 특유의 움직임이 죽었고 (사실 별로 고해상도도 아니다), 캐릭터도 많이 삭제됐다. 작업 편의를 위해서였는지 캐릭터도 날씬이랑 벌크캐 두 부류로 재편성?되어 캐릭터 느낌도 변했다.

18263742.review:
the original kof 2002 is one of my favorite kof games since im kind of a fan of dream matches, really the only enjoyable thing on mario and sonic on the olymipcs. but what's new on the table for this revised edition?
well for starters there's a whole new ost and the backgrounds have been redone but that's what you see at a first glance so what's the big deal with this one?
for the good things it does.
+great presentation, pixelart is incredible,the new soundtrack is great, overwhenlming attention to detail, animations are fluid it gets all the right bucks for what its going for.
+huge roster of characters even including more than the original but since nothing is cannon here why not put some charaters from the other sagas and spinoffs? like kagura or ash being a boss in the game? hell, even maximum impact has some cool designs, ill give it that.
+great gameplay as allways, what i like about this franchise is that its experimental, they're allways switching systems, some examples are striker, classic and special but in most of these the goal is getting filling up your energy bar so you can enter max mode, its cool because this lets you do the amazing combos you see on the trailers, but since the combos are soo over the top you have to earn the right to do them, and should i add, to make a decent chain is the work of a trooper so as you can see here, its not the most user friendly game ever...but its necessary so no one dies every 2 seconds.
+daisuke ono of course, you need daisuke ono in your fighting game if you want to have a kickass game, its necessary.
+the bouncy mai cheat's on by default.
but it does a few things wrong and could have some more key features.
-you know, making custom color palettes is a fun thing, that isn't in this game.
-one would expect to have the old stages of the game redone, but there's none of the old scenarios, same goes for the ost, it would have been nice to see an ast for the original game... but budget cuts..
-multiplayer is worthless,since no one plays this game, or any other kof game while we are at it, but it was a huge sucsess here in mexico!
-no story, that's what happens when you make a dream match everybody.
-a little nitpic here but arcade mode just has 5 fights including the final boss and then credits.... even the original had more matches than that, and on an arcade you can only play the main campaign so what the heckie?
. but this game just makes me go, yeah. it'll make you as well go, yeah, it'll make your friends go, yeah.
and if my recomendation helps you pick it up the invite me for matches cuz i've got no one to play with in fact i only made this review so that more people can play with me please don't leave me alone!
7.5/10
just make this franchise mainstream for the love of god, i dont want it to die again because of its new reboot, kof 14...
i just know it'll be a dissaster.

17209371.review:
This game is indeed a work of art. Just about every member of this game's huge 60+ character roster is lethal. Beginners may have a tough time with things like learning whole teams or executing some of the higher damaging combos for certain cast members but the game is generally forgiving due to it's focus on strong pokes, unlike KoF XIII which is centered around big damage from light-confirms. And much like most other KoF games, the focus here is movement options, which can leave players from more footsie-based games (like street fighter) feeling overwhelmed/stiff until they get a grip on how to move and how to counter the options.

The netcode is wonderful (comparable to GGPO in feel but it's actually not rollback based AFAIK)  but don't expect terrific performance on WiFi (fighting games generally hate dropped packets). My only gripe is a lack of matchmaking options and chat.

And last but not least, the presentation of the game itself. The voice acting and music is superb (comparable to the likes of Guilty Gear) and I'd buy an OST CD if it was ever made available. Lots of stages if you care about that sort of thing. One fault I'd like to address here is the lack of color options / custom palletes.

Overall this port of the game is the definitive version of an almost flawless fighting game and I'd say it's an instant buy if you're even remotely interested in the series.

16969470.review:
Before reading this, know that I own and have played plenty of fighting games, including Street Fighter, Tekken, DBZX (doesn't really count here) and both Wii and Xbox versions of NSUNS. I don't want to come across as arrogant, but I know what i'm talking bout when it comes to 2D fighters.

REAL REVIEW FOLLOWS

Pros:
+Great soundtracks
+Huge roster with very diverse characters
+Amazing online play
+Nostalgiac pixelated graphics
+Smooth gameplay
+Steam Trading Cards :)

Cons:
-Small number of online players
-No story/career mode (not really a problem with endless, team play and challange)

First of all, the all important graphics. While the pixelated arcade fighter graphics may be a major turn off for some people- and believe me, I initially didn't want to buy a pixelated fighter, however my graphics card would not allow that- it really, REALLY works with the game. You really get the feeling of playing a traditional 2D fighter. Once you start getting into the game, it really doesn't bother you. You want the pixelated graphics. You want the artwork border. And you want it to be hard to tell if a character is half nude or not (helps a lot when a parent comes in the room ;)

Online gameplay is amazingly smooth. If you have a lower end computer, you may experience very minimal lag, otherwise you'll play as if it was you versus the AI. There's actually a setting to limit the amount of frame lag there can possibly be in your match. The only problem is that there aren't too many players online all the time. Try playing later in the day, or grab a friend.

Now for the actual gameplay. KoF 2002 UM's mechanics and responsiveness is golden. Never have i had a game related problem with playing the game, not even online. This means maybe I messed up a combo move, but i've never had the game cause me to mess it up. Every character is balanced and equally powerful in my opinion. Some moves are more powerful than others, some more annoying than others. But that's one of the main components of a fighting game: every character is different and takes a different level of skill to master. There are some characters designed for veteran players- namely May, who has two different play modes in one- and some designed for beginners- namely Bao, who has a very simple moveset.

The actual roster is expansive, much larger than most fighting games including SSF4:AE, with 66 playable characters. About 60 if you discount the Orochis and secret form characters. For younger players, players with protective parents or Muslims (like me), most of the females are actually dressed decently, and I would confidently play as them in front of my parents. Stay away from Angel♥, Mai, Vice, Mature, Blue Mary, Leona, Foxy, Vanessa and Shermie. If you choose Hinako, be aware that she may panty flash you at the beginning of the match. 

Just about every other aspect of the game is perfect. This is a great purchase for fighter fans and those looking for an exuse to smash their best friend's face in. If overpriced at all, I would say only by about a cent. Maybe 2 cents. If you really don't want to pay full price, grab it on sale. I got my copy and a friend's for about 6$. 

Thanks for reading my long♥ss review. Goodl uck becoming the the King of Fighters! Take it easy! (Billy reference)

16471912.review:
Beeing a long time fan of SNK, this was a big surprise. To see a masterpiece completely remade and brought into Steam. This game is perfect for those fans who are looking for that nostalgic feel of 2D fighters, while enjoying fast paced battles with very good music to help induce the hype. 

The graphics have been improved, the gameplay as well (to a very good extent) and you have a huge roster of 66 characters to choose from (including bosses and EX versions of a few characters!), all unlocked from the start! 

Not only that, but the achievements in this game are a real challange to get, giving the feel that you are actually achieving something worth fighting for! What more could you ask for?

The only things in this game that may be a reason to complain are: The controls aren't really that good for the keyboard (you will most likely have a hard time with difficult inputs such as Nameless' Rasen super) and you will often see yourself playing with more simple characters like Iori, Ralf or the Kyo Clones (which, in my opinion were a really good adition for those who like Kyo's old design and moveset better). 

There is no story in this game, making it simply a character mosh pit (much like Marvel Vs. Capcom 2 though this games' roster is bigger) so fans who wish to get to know their favourites will probably be disappointed. 

And don't think you can play this as you would Street Fighter, or else you're going to have a hard time! ;)

In the end...

I give this a solid: 9\10!

16339483.review:
[b] **** QUICK REVIEW **** (focussing on online) [/b]

[b] THE GOOD [/b]
If you're a fan of the older games, and you have someone [i](or several)[/i] to play with, you should get this. Basically, it's the ultimate resource for KoF, and I think this is the best overall roster list you can get right now. You can see the complete roster online, but you're really spoiled for choice with this game!

It also has great controller support. Both my Xbox 360 pad and my SNES pad work perfectly, which isn't all that common for the SNES pad. And of course, keyboard is there for those that want it.

[b] THE BAD [/b]
There's not really a story mode though, and this means there's no character interaction beyond the intro to a fight, where some characters might have a unique animation+sound depending on who they meet [i](e.g. Shingo vs Kyo)[/i]. But keep in mind it's all Japanese audio with no subs.


[b] THE ONLINE [/b]
KoF13 has connectivity issues, but in 2002 Ultimate Match [b]online play actually works![/b] However, you may have to "shop around" players for a decent ping [i](there are no servers, it's all peer to peer)[/i]. I've found anything up to [b]250ms to be perfectly smooth while 500 was unplayable[/b].

Online play is dependent entirely on ping, so if your opponent is based far away, the game will slow down to keep both players [b]exactly[/b] in sync. This means that you can play with anyone in the world and have an equal chance to win, but far away players result in the game being played in slow motion! The closer you are to them, the faster the gaming experience.
You can see someone's ping before you play with them and cancel out if it's too high, but if you accidentally go ahead, there's no way of quitting without forcing the game to close via Windows!

[i]Possible Tip: There's a setting in the Network section of the Options menu that lets you change the frame count for input when online. Normally it's set to 9, but after changing it to 3 I got far better pings on opponents. It could be coincidence, but it's unclear how they've implemented their netcode.[/i]

16250946.review:
Posiblemente es la mejor version de KOF que hay, casi todo el repertorio de personajes desde la 99-2002 esta disponible desde el inicio incluyendo los jefes. Muchos personajes tienen mas movimientos y especiales en comparacion con la 2002 de Arcade y el sistema de combos se siente mucho mas comodo.
Si eres de los que les gusta jugar en maquinitas las versiones Plus el juego permite tener barras de poderes al maximo todo el tiempo, he jugado creo que 10 veces las horas registradas con amigos en la escuela en modo desconectado.

La banda sonora del juego es infinitamente mejor que su version original incluyendo arreglos de musica muy buenos de la 2002 original y nuevos temas para cada equipo y jefe incluido en esta version. En mi opinion es el mejor soundtrack que he escuchado en un kof, por lo menos me han gustado el 90% de ellas.

Pros:

-Gameplay mejorado (con respecto al original)
-Muy Buen soundtrack
-Mas de 50 pesonajes a elegir

Cons:
-Online con mucho lag (no en todas las partidas, pero si muchas)
-No posee la version original a comparacion con la 98 UM
-Galeria de Imagenes no disponible individualmente (tienes que completar el modo Team Play obligatoriamente)
-Rugal no te hace Gay, usar a Krizalid SI. Y Igniz ni se diga.

15670514.review:
Ищете веселый файтинг для вечеринки? Тогда продолжайте поиски дальше, вы сюда пришли точно не по адресу. 

The King of Fighters 2002: Unlimited Match является, пожалуй, одним из самых хардкорных игр в жанре "файтинг", и если вы считаете Street Fighter IV "слишком задротской для освоения", то данная игра определенно откроет вам новые горизонты.

Представьте такую ситуацию - вы только что увидели файтинг, о котором вы мало что знаете, но слышали о нем весьма хорошие отзывы. Запустив ее, вы сразу лезете в аркадный режим, где вашему выбору предоставляется широчайший выбор из 66 бойцов (причем некоторые из них имеют альтернативные версии). Выбрав первого приглянувшегося бойца вы начинаете бои с первыми противниками, где вас изобьют как щенка где-нибудь в третьем уровне.

Слегка прифигев от произошедшего, вы открываете список приемов, и от того, какого персонажа вы выбрали и в насколько сложные файтинги вы до этого играли, зависит длина падения вашей челюсти - приемы в большинстве случаев достаточно сложны для выполнения даже на геймпаде, особенно когда одни приемы представляют собой длинную цепочку из двух-трех связок, а другие требуют скрупулезной точности расчета времени для их выполнения. 

Потратив минут 10 на выучивание базовых приемов бойца в режиме тренировки и поняв "что да как", вы предпринимаете повторную попытку покорить аркадный режим, где вас сливают уже на пятом уровне. И неудивительно - в этой игре столько нюансов, которые нужно учитывать во время боя, что делает KOF не просто киберспортивной дисциплиной, а целой наукой. Да тут одних видов прыжков аж четыре штуки, а какая тут запутанная система боя "земля-воздух"/"воздух-земля"! Про систему комбо я вообще молчу - здесь при особом умении можно выделывать такие кренделя, гарантированно отнимащих у врага больше половины жизни.

Итак, вы провели в тренировочном режиме как минимум час, научились выбивать приемы и простые комбо вплоть до полного автоматизма, прочли тонны мануалов, просмотрели сотни обучающих видео, и наконец готовы поборотся за титул "Короля бойцов". Вот тогда победив шесть первых соперников, вы наконец добираетесь до финального уровня, где ощущаете все прелести "синдрома босса SNK" на своей шкуре - боссы здесь настолько мощные и читерные, что на их фоне Шао Кан из Mortal Kombat покажется вам малолетним шалопаем.

И вы знаете, это довольно приятно. Эта игра является отличным полигоном для развития и оттачивания своих навыков, каждая битва представляет собой один сложный танец, а победа доставляет кучу удовольствия и чувства самоудовлетворения типа "вот это я реально продвинулся". И все это под отличный техно-метал саундтрек и на фоне красиво нарисованных арен. Спрайты бойцов могут отпугнуть особо не подготовленных игроков, но в динамике ты не обращаешь внимание на их пикселизированность, да и анимированы они годно (не уровень Melty Blood конечно, но и не режет глаза).

Могу ли я порекомендовать игру? Просто позвольте мне задать вам один вопрос...

Готовы ли вы покорить вершину?

15348137.review:
THIS REVIEW IS DEDICATED TO THOSE WHO DON'T HAVE MUCH EXPERIENCE WITH 2002 OR KOF SERIES

I'm a seasoned SNK/Fighting games veteran. I own all of SNK's games on Steam, and I say: this game sucks.

I _know_ this game has lots of fans and all, and many who appreciate its style. However, I'd _really_ rather stick to '98 and XIII, because they're original, unique, have a good feel, good music, good graphics, nice characters, are overall solidly built and have a good flow. 2002, even UM, is unoriginal, lame, plastic and rotten. If you're an old-time lover of this game, of course you love it, but if you're new to the series, stick to '98 and XIII, they're both excellent, deep and rewarding to learn.

If you wanna try it, see for yourself; maybe you can like it. I'm still trying, but as for now, I wish I could get a refund.

Okay so. KoF02UM Is pretty much everything you need in a KoF game. Lots of characters, nice looking backgrounds, and great music, and various game modes to keep you distracted. If you have some friends or siblings who are also into KoF, well i don't think the game will be getting stale any time soon since the amount of characters in this game gives you a infinate amount of teams you could have in the Vs. mode. 

Oh yeah. and all the boss characters are unlocked already in this version. In the Xbox Live Arcade version you had to play through Endless Mode, or Arcade Mode and defeat that specific character. So if ya suck. you don't have to worry about it.

And if you didn't know already. Some characters have alternate versions of themselves if you hold the Start button on that character and choose them. Examples would be, Kensou (KoF '99), Robert (KoF '99 to 2000), and the entire Orochi Team.

15321924.review:
2002是一款永遠不滅的格鬥名作，UM版改進了不少02的缺點，但同時因為人數過多而暴露出更多缺點...
一味地衝高人數反而讓平衡無法兼顧，不過仍是值得一玩的上乘之作，可惜，這個值得一玩並不是在STEAM版上；
比起家用主機版，STEAM版售價並未便宜多少，但PS2版的缺點(解析度)不見改善，且PS2版的優點也不見保留，
人物只有四種顏色可供選擇，讓人失望透頂，卻又閹割掉了PS2版最大亮點的調色盤功能...讓人錯愕萬分；
同時，影像鋸齒跟馬賽克的問題也未針對STEAM做優化調整，狗牙鋸齒滿天飛，包含片頭跟破關影片等...，
完完全全浪費了人物設定那精美的畫風跟上色。
唯一可取之處就是連線十分順暢，不會有LAG的問題，但綜合以上幾點，加上先前98UM的例子來看，
SNK不只是一家吃老本的公司，且連移植這種低成本作為的舉動都不見其誠意，讓人失望，
甚至會讓玩家感到質疑是否使用非法跟盜版的玩家可以得到更好的遊戲感受~

以上，若您仍對SNK在STEAM上移植的老遊戲作品感到有興趣，想要收藏，提醒您，它只值75%折扣甚至
更高的折扣價格，低於75%的折扣請不要衝動，因為絕對不值得!!

O sistema online está mais estável (dá pra jogar com a maioria acima de 200 ms de ping). Uma gama de lutadores à disposição + personagens melhorados (como o K', causando aí uma série de 'apelações') mas não menos equilibrado, aparentemente. Destaque também para a trilha sonora caprichada (fazendo a versão original parecer um mero mid) e a arte das animações que ganharam aí uma evolução invocada. 

Num conjunto, são tantas diferenças em relação a versão original que The King 2002 UM chega a parecer uma transgressão de The King 98 UM (há uma certa semelhança em ambos quanto aos elementos artísticos e elenco ultra dimensional de lutadores - incluindo os que ficaram de fora dos primeiros"slugfests"). Sem dúvida alguma, um dos melhores jogos da série (isso contando também as edições originais e as atualizadas para outros sistemas).

:D :D :D Oh my god is this port fantastic. CodeMystics did a great job porting this over to the PC. Any old potato or toaster could run this game with barely any hassle, and all the bosses are unlocked from the start so you don't HAVE to struggle through all the challenges (Although you can for the achievement, which was originally for unlocking everyone)

Since this is a port from the Xbox 360 version and not the PS2, you don't get 3D stages or Colour Edit, but you know what? The hell with them, Rugal's 2D stage is far better than that naff 3D PS2 stage porting job and most online colours tend to be bad MS Paint jobs.

Netcode varies between great and meh, but when its good, it is awesome. I totally recommend picking this up, especially for the priceand to play one of the absolute BEST KOF games.

This'll probably happen to you:

9001/10. One of the best boss fights in fighting game history.

While KOF XIII is a great game and is a lot of fun to play, so far KOF 2002 is my favorite of the two. The roster of 2002 is way bigger than in XIII, (there are 66 fighters for you to pick!) i really like the pixelated style of the game and many characters got an overhaul by getting new moves added to their moveset.
The controls are fluent, the special moves are easy to remember and use and i also like the fact that it actually makes a difference if you do a special move with either a light kick or a hard kick, that adds a lot more strategy to the fights.

The netcode of this game is a mixed bag, sometimes the netcode is really good, the game is fluent but other times the game runs really slow and / or choppy, but most of the time it's good. You can also see the ping difference between you and the guy you want to play against in the lobby, so if the ping is too high, you can still leave or kick the guy.

The developers are also very close to the community, they patch the game regulary and the community as a whole is very helpful.

So overall, if you enjoy fighting games with a huge variety of characters and a very high learning curve (and if you are not afraid to get your ass handed to you online) get this game. You won't regret it.

14833057.review:
Like the King of Fighters '98 UM FE port on Steam, The King of Fighters 2002 UM port has decent netcode. I play with someone about halfway across the US and don't ever have any lag problems regardless of what the ping indicator says. Just making it that far is a struggle for the more poorly coded games, so I would assume it's good enough for continental US. Anyway, now that the most important thing is out of the way...

While 98UM FE feels pretty much like '98 to me, 2002UM feels significantly different than the 2002 I'm used to. Admittedly I've always been more of a '98 person so my playtime on 2002 isn't that high but this version feels much faster and the controls more fluid than I remember. The balance too is definitely better and most of the characters feel improved over the way they were before rather than nerfed (though there are some exceptions!). I still feel like there are some weird hitboxes, but that's not a terribly big deal compared to psycho ball cheese.

The presentation is improved, but there's only so much you can do with the ancient sprites. Whether portraits or menus pretty much everything is redrawn that isn't the actual sprites. There are new stages with cameos of other SNK characters too if you like that, but unfortunately no sort of filter to help alleviate your eyes of the pixels the size of your eyes for the actual sprites themselves.  More importantly though, the game also has an arranged soundtrack with the character themes in it. A pretty good one at that. It's one of the best additions for sure because the music Eolith put in 2002 was absolutely terrible.

'98 may be a bit dated for people who didn't play fighting games before their revival with Street Fighter 4, but I feel this version of 2002 is definitely something that can be appreciated by both newer and older players alike. It's a much better port job than 98UM FE and a fast paced, exciting game. I'm hoping more classic fighters hit Steam soon.

What else is there to say? This is the definitive version of King of Fighters. The pixel art may turn off some, but if you came in to the series with KoF13, you'll find a good amount of your knowledge will translate well here. The Netcode's all right, though if you play wirelessly, you're going to have a bad time. Definitely go wired.

14711619.review:
Probably the best KoF game ever.
2002 Unlimited Match is a vastly improved version over the original 2002 vanilla, adding a moltitude of pretty new stuff. The game has a total of 66 characters including bosses and EX characters, new BGMs, new stages, new HUD, new artwork and overall a great balance.
The PC port is good, and is based on the Tougeki version which is the latest out. The netcode is not using GGPO, but a delay-based netcode which works well. You will probably notice lag, if you try to play between two continents, but at least you can set your max input delay manually like in 98UM to compensate the lag.
The price is a bit high, but if you're a fan of fighting games every cent spent is definitely worth. A masterpiece.

一世を風靡した故SNKの看板タイトルKOFシリーズのリメイク。
98と2002UMは(KOFの中では)バランスの良さに定評があり、
ファンの間で根強い人気を誇っています。

今や格闘ゲーム自体がニッチなジャンルとなっていますが
対戦ツールとしては割と良い出来です。
古い映像なので、パッと見は冴えないかもしれませんが
友人とローカル対戦するにはイイ作品ですΣd(ﾟдﾟ*)ｨｨ!

オンラインの方ですが、
コンボに多少精密さを必要とするゲームなので、
一部のキャラは、少々のラグで不安定になる欠点があります。
最近の格闘ゲームと違いラグ対策はしていないので
良い回線を使わないとオンの対戦は辛いかもしれません。
先程、バランスが良いとは言いましたが
K`･香澄･ネームレス辺りの遭遇率がやたら高いと感じる事でしょう。

ちなみにPC＆何度もリメイク＆レトロという事もあってか、
発売して二日後の週末でも人があまりいません。
MMBB以下で同じ人と何度も対戦できる程です。
オンライン対戦ゲームは世界中の人達と戦える！
という醍醐味があるのに、それが無いとなると…

まぁ、定価は安いですし、
最初から日本語付きという長所？があります。
BGMも過去最高とも言える出来です。
昔はこういう格闘ゲームが流行っていたと

勿論格ゲー好きやKOF好きにもお勧め。

14696400.review:
Anteriormente lanzado para Playstation 2 y después a Xbox Live Arcade. King of Fighters 2002 Unlimited Match es la actualización definitiva de King of Fighters 2002 de NeoGeo con nuevos fondos, movimientos, personajes y jugabilidad ajustada.

Específicamente la versión de Steam es la misma de XBLA con un nuevo protocolo para el multijugador en linea. 

Es un "Dream Match" que toma los hechos de la saga NESTS (99-01) y donde vuelven algunos personajes muertos en la historia original.

Incluye un incremento de personajes haciendo a este el King of Fighters mas amplio en selección de peleadores, a diferencia de la original de NeoGeo que tenia 44 (creo que esta tiene 66). Trae de nuevo a los jefes de todas las versiones de KOF anteriores, Se retira al personaje K9999 debido a su similitud con un personaje de anime y se sustituye por otro muy similar sin nombre (Nameless).

Lo que me hubiera gustado aun mas es que incluyera el original de NeoGeo, la opción de galería que fueron retirados de la versión de PS2 y como siempre un mejor protocolo en linea sin tanto retraso. 

Aun así lo recomiendo ampliamente ya que como lo puse antes, estamos frente a la actualización definitiva del mejor KOF con un balance mejorado y nuevos personajes.

14692635.review:
It has all come down to this with one of the best 'dream match' series amongst all KOFs. 

The King of Fighters 2002: Unlimited Match is an enhanced version of King of Fighters 2002 released February 2009 on the PlayStation 2 and November 2010 for Xbox Live Arcade. The game features an all new arranged soundtrack updated stages with a playable cast that is probably one of the biggest among the fight games - all mashed up as one ultimate 2D fighting title. 

The combo system is very deep and elevates gameplay experience. One thing I find peaculiar is the character sprites of 2002 on Steam seems to be more pixelated than the 98 edition. I am hoping a future patch will fix that.

Definitely a strong recommendation to fighting game fans and more so for KOF players.

Tested the game with Qanba Q4RAF fight stick and some cheap unbranded joypad, both works fine on Windows 8.1 platform.

14688480.review:
Ah yes, one of my favorite king of fighters titles. This game boasts the largest roster of any KoF game so far and will have a very familiar max cancel system to those coming from XIII.

Let's get right down to it. It's an XBLA port, so it's the Tougeki version. That means this is the arcade version that has all of the latest balance changes. If you've played the XBLA version, it's that but with playable online, input delay features, and every character unlocked at the beginning.

For those that haven't, it includes your typical arcade mode with single play and team play. You have your versus modes, you can fight the CPU, etc. Endless mode is there to grind it out and see how far you can make it. Online mode has both player and ranked, but you stay in the same lobby in ranked. It's not something I've ever seen in a fighter, but whatever.

Since this is based off of the XBLA version you'll get the AST, 2D backgrounds, and no fancy camera intro. All of which are an exact 1:1 of the arcade version.

Here's the bottom line, if you're buying this because you want an arcade perfect port with playable online, you're making the right choice. If you want all the bells and whistles of the PS2 version like 3D backgrounds, color editor, gallery, etc. Well, this isn't probably for you. If you just want it to play with a friend, buy it now.

Personally, being arcade perfect and able to play online is far more important to me. Fyi, the ending images are in the game's directory, so there's your gallery, hah.

14688248.review:
While the original King Of Fighters 2002 is massively played, I think the original version is a mess of a game. Terrible, sloppy balancing, missing key characters (King), the soundtrack was god awful, and the presentation was weak. However after 1999, 2000 and 2001, one thing 2002 did right was return KOF back to it's roots after years of experimenting with new system mechanics that weren't well recieved, such as the Striker system.

The King Of fighters 2002 Unlimited Match much like '98 Ultimate Match before it, is a complete overhaul of the original game. Hell 2k2UM is an even bigger overhaul than 98UM was. KOF2k2UM brings back everybody from the NESTS Saga as 98UM brought back everybody from the Orochi Saga. Plus it also brings back the New Faces Team from KOF97, this being a Dream Match game and all. 2k2UM also includes characters from the PS2 version of the original 2002, such as Goenitz and Geese! 

2k2UM beefs up many characters movelists with moves that 99/00/01 introduced, along with some new additions, for example Mai Shiranui has her rekka special move straight out of Real Bout Fatal Fury Special, and Terry Bogard gained his Quick Burn special move from Real Bout Fatal Fury Special: Dominated Minds, which is a pretty obscure move from a very obscure game.

Alongside new moves for many characters, 2k2UM also brings EX versions of characters such as Robert, Kensou and Takuma from 99/00. EX Robert is a charge style character, while EX Kensou  does not have his psychic powers, and EX Takuma is pretty much alot like 98 Takuma.

Probably the biggest improvement from the original 2002 to UM is the presentation. The game looks very nice and refined, backgrounds are fantastic, HUD looks great, and the soundtrack is a huge improvement over the original, some of my favorite themes being Kyokugenryu Team, Korea Team, and the new Mustard For Geese arrangement.

As with 98UMFE on Steam, 2k2UM is based on the Xbox Live Arcade version of the game, which is in turn based on the 2002UM Tougeki arcade update of the game. Unlike the XBLA version though, the netcode in this version is pretty solid from what I played. I managed to play with a friend all the way from California with barely 4-5 frames of input delay at 150-200ms ping, which is pretty playable.

Players coming from 98UM should feel pretty well at home with 2k2UM, although 2k2UM has a bit of a different feel from 98UM. 2k2UM is alot faster, and the controls are more loose compared to 98UM's tightness, although it's not nearly as loose as say KOFXIII. 

If you are a KOF/SNK fan or just a fan of fighting games in general, I highly recommend picking up this game. If you are new to fighters though, you may want to tread lightly. This game is extremely unforgiving as most KOF games tend to be. If your only fighting game experiences are with games like Street Fighter or Mortal Kombat, you are in for one helluva ride.

14683456.review:
The King of Fighters é uma série de jogos de luta pela empresa SNK, sendo originalmente planejado como um crossover interno, mas depois sendo o produto carro-chefe da empresa, com a mais recente versão sendo o The King of Fighters XIII, disponível também na STEAM.

Depois da bem sucedida saga Orochi e seu game "dream match", KOF 98, SNKP então começou a nova saga NESTS em 1999. Um Cartel misterioso envolvido em pesquisas genéticas (influenciadas pela época como relatos da ovelha Dolly), abandonando o ar mais mistico e tendo um "feeling" mais moderno e "dark", junto com seu novo protagonista K'. Porém foi uma época turbulenta para a empresa até que a mesma faliu em 2000 com o que pensava ser seu ultimo KOF. Porém surpreendemente a saga foi concluida com ajuda da empresa coreana Eolith, que também contribuiu com o segundo jogo de dream match, KOF 2002.

KOF 2002 é o segundo jogo de comemoração da franquia, porém ao contrário do KOF 98 ele divide seus fãs. Muitos criticam a parte gráfica "suja" do game com cenários tendo poucos frames e cores, músicas de baixa qualidade comparada com as versões clássicas, além de omissões de personagens queridos que estavam presentes em 98 como Shingo Yabuki e King, o time americano e o time dos "mestres foi desfeito. Mesmo assim foi um jogo que competitivamente na America Latina rendeu contras, entre seu cast retornam novamente o time orochi, o time das beldades teve King substituida pela discipula de Jhun Hoom de KOF 99, May Lee (apresentada em KOF 2001), e Yuri retorna desde 95 deixando que seu pai retorne ao time AOF.As adições no game original claro são os personagens da saga NESTS, o time representando 99 sendo K', Maxima e Whip, os novatos de 2000 representando o game com Vanessa, Ramon e Seth e terminando com o grupo representando o cartel, Kula, Angel e o polêmico K9999 (substituido na versão unlimited match por motivos não claros até hoje).

O game abandona o sistema de Extra e Advanced, simplesmente usando um sistema mais direto com recuros de "Free Cancel" e "Max Mode", permitindo versões melhoradas dos DMs como também cancelar mais facilmentes golpes e especiais em combos "estourando" a barra, além da adição de "HSDMS", que só podem ser usados com energia baixa e 2 estoques de especiais. Os ports caseiros tiveram adições positivas como retorno de King e Shingo, além de adição de Goenitz, Geese e Orochi Iori, esses três ultimos tendo movimentos do jogo SVC: Snk vs Capcom. Após isso a empresa começou a nova saga envolvendo Ash Crimson e um grupo querendo o retorno de Orochi.

Vendo que King of Fighters 98 Ultimate Match teve uma boa aceitação, ela anunciou que KOF 2002 teria também o mesmo tratamento. E que tratamento! Sendo originalmente lançado para o sistema PlayStation 2 em Fevereiro de 2009, ele trouxe praticamente todos os personagens participantes da saga, sendo os clones de Kyo, Bao, Kasumi, Li Xianfei, Jhun Hoom, além de King e Shingo (caso tenha ignorado as versões caseiras), de KOF 2000 e 2001 também retornaram Hinako, Lin, Heidern e Foxy. Geese retorna junto com Goenitz das versões caseiras por algum motivo, além de todos os chefes de NESTS podendo serem enfrentados pela CPU e desbloqueáveis. Os únicos personagens que não compareceram ou foi por não aparecerem nos games dessa época ou não se sabe, Orochi Iori não está presente (ironicamente Leona pode se transformar em sua versão Orochi) e K9999 foi substituido pelo único personagem novo: Nameless, substituindo o mesmo em storyline, dublado por Daisuke Ono e também herdando o moveset do maluco. Uma teoria bem difundida foi por questão de direitos autorais com o autor do filme de animação "Akira", porém K9999 foi visto recentemente em um jogo mobile, então é um mistério...Omega Rugal foi dublado pelo famoso Norio Wakamoto em KOF 2002 mas em Unlimited Match ele é novamente redublado por Toshimitsu Arai para a alegria dos fãs. Há versões alternativas de Takuma, Kensou, Robert e Geese para ainda mais personagens.

De cenários e músicas originais nada foi reaproveitado do 2002 original (hilariamente o cenário 3D de Omega Rugal das versões caseiras foi para os mais atentos), novas músicas foram compostas e remixes dos clássicos são dignos de suas versões originais dessa vez. O game assim como 98UM foi portado retalhado para a XBox Live em Novembro de 2010, sem cenários 3Ds e outros features, e sem possibilidade de jogar o KOF 2002 original (não foi para nos poupar, foi pela simples "falta de espaço" pelas regras imbecis da Microsoft em sua rede online).

Adivinha denovo que versão nós recebemos? Duas chances, e a primeira não conta.

Infelizmente recebemos novamente a versão inferior de um dreammatch, e o pior que não houve revisões depois da versão "Tougeki", sendo claramente uma versão pior que o PlayStation 2 recebeu. Em KOF 98UM não é tão aparente mas os cenários "adptados" para 2D sendo vistos em 1080p dá para ver claramente que não foram bem convertidos para serem usados em resoluções maiores, é aparente o "dithering" neles.

O modo online está "bom" como no port anterior de King of Fighters 98 Ultimate Match, tendo bom netcode baseado em delay e podendo ver o atraso ativando uma opção. Porém AINDA é restrito para 1 vs 1 pessoa, sem multi lobbies e modo expectador, o que vai com certeza machucar a população online no futuro e dificultando que os mais novatos testem o game e tenham chance de melhorarem no game não sendo atraidos por features modernas. Também organização de campeonatos online sofre...

Recomendado? Muito conflitado mas no final das contas é um polegar positivo, Mystic Code apesar de não ir além do que a SNKP pede, eles dessa vez fizeram um bom código de netplay com a experiência que tiveram com KOF 98UM, me irrita o fato do online ser limitado em modos e funções mas é inegável ser competente.

Compre agora se for muito fã de KOF e não tem problemas com o online "cru", sendo um fã mais casual recomendo esperar um desconto por não ter modos que justifiquem o preço normal, é bem mais preferivel ir atrás e importar a versão de PlayStation 2 que conta com muito mais extras. O atrativo deste port é ter "algum" online e poder rodar em pc sem precisar configurar muito.
